thread.title: Ronald McDonald statue hamburgled from Mass. home; family offers reward for return
thread.title_full: Ronald McDonald statue hamburgled from Mass. home; family offers reward for return | NOLA.com

author: Associated Press
title: Ronald McDonald statue hamburgled from Mass. home; family offers reward for return
text:
NORTHAMPTON, Mass. â€” A Massachusetts family has been searching in vain for its "slightly sinister" statue of Ronald McDonald, which was taken from their summer home during a teenage house party.
Mary Ryan told the Daily Hampshire Gazette that the 3-foot-high statue of the fast food pitchman was taken in August, when her daughter hosted an unauthorized party at the house in Leverett.
Two boys put the statue in a tree at an athletic club, she said. Someone later took it out of the tree and posted a photo of it on Instagram next to a trash bin.
The statue hasn't been seen since.
Ryan and her husband, an artist, bought the statue years ago for $1,200. Ryan said it has a "slightly sinister quality."
They're offering a $300 reward.
The daughter was punished with extra chores.
Where's Ronald? After a statue of Ronald McDonald went missing in August, a Northampton woman has tracked the statue's movements on social media and put up fliers offering a $300 reward.
Posted by Daily Hampshire Gazette on Friday, October 16, 2015
